metadata.Title: CVE-2018-16877 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the way pacemaker's client-server authentication was implemented in versions up to and including 2.0.0. A local attacker could use this flaw, and combine it with other IPC weaknesses, to achieve local privilege escalation.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16877` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcib4 - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1.6
libcrmcluster4 - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1.6
libcrmcommon3 - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1.6
libcrmservice3 - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1.6
liblrmd1 - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1.6
libpe-rules2 - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1.6
libpe-status10 - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1.6
libpengine10 - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1.6
libstonithd2 - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1.6
libtransitioner2 - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1.6
pacemaker - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1.6
pacemaker-cli-utils - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1.6
pacemaker-common - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1.6
pacemaker-remote - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1.6
pacemaker-resource-agents - 1.1.14-2ubuntu1.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pacemaker package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.1.14-2ubuntu1.6').
